hero.title: Water Resources Engineering & Climate Center
hero.description: We advance socio-hydro-climate understanding and co-create innovative approaches to build a sustainable and resilient future for water, climate, and society.

about.title: Data, Innovation, and Resilience
about.desc: A hub for integrated water–climate research, education, and outreach at Universitas Gadjah Mada.

card1.title: Hydro-Climate Informatics
card1.desc: Advanced models, decision-support systems, and digital platforms (incl. GIS and integrated modeling) to predict and mitigate water-related risks.

card2.title: Community-Based Management
card2.desc: Empowering local communities through participatory irrigation, rural water development, and watershed conservation with training and consultancy.

vision.title: Socio-Hydro-Climate leadership for a resilient future
vision.desc: We enhance knowledge exchange, educate the next generation, coordinate interdisciplinary initiatives, and build bridges with partners.
vision.point1: Enhance exchange of ideas across disciplines.
vision.point2: Educate problem-solvers on water, climate, and equity.
vision.point3: Coordinate new programs, facilities, and services.
vision.point4: Build bridges with academic, public, and international partners.

scope.title: Advancing Socio-Hydro-Climate Research
scope.desc: Our interdisciplinary research integrates hydrology, climate science, and community-based approaches to tackle water challenges at every scale.

item1.title: Historical & Future Hydro-Climate Database
item1.desc: A comprehensive database of past and projected hydrological and climate data for trend analysis, scenario modeling, and long-term planning.

item2.title: Hydro-Climate Informatics & Technology
item2.desc: Decision-support systems, hydroinformatics, and GIS-based analysis to improve water security and resilience.

item3.title: Socio-Hydro-Climate & Innovative Technologies
item3.desc: Tools that combine social, hydrological, and climate knowledge to support irrigation and community-based water management.

item4.title: Community-Based Management
item4.desc: Participatory irrigation, rural water development, and capacity building for equitable governance and sustainability.

milestones.title: Roadmap to 2040
milestones.desc: We are setting long-term goals to strengthen climate-adaptive research and build lasting impact.
milestones.item1: Establish a 5-Year Research Roadmap for climate-adaptive irrigation, flood & drought resilience, climate projections, and the water-energy-food nexus.
milestones.item2: Launch annual joint research programs, international publications, policy briefs, seminars, and workshops with partners.
milestones.item3: Expand short courses and training for governments and communities to strengthen water & climate adaptation capacity.
milestones.item4: Achieve full integration of research, education, and outreach; become a national & Asia-Pacific reference hub.

team.title: Researchers with diverse expertise
team.desc: Dedicated to addressing sustainability and environmental resilience challenges.

contact.title: Get in touch
contact.desc: We’d love to collaborate on research, training, and community impact.
